title: Springer Municipal Airport
text:
Springer Municipal Airport is a town owned, public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located one <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a> (2 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) south of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Springer%2C%20New%20Mexico">Springer</a>, a town in <a href="Colfax%20County%2C%20New%20Mexico">Colfax County, New Mexico</a>, United States. It is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Springer Municipal Airport covers an area of 108 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (44 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 5,891 feet (1,796 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 1/19 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 5,003 by 60 feet (1,525 x 18 m). For the 12-month period ending April 30, 2010, the airport had 30 aircraft operations, an average of 2 per month: 67% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> and 33% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>.
